title: YouTube Video Editor & Content Ideator for True Crime Channel
job_overview:
Hi there,
I’m running a YouTube channel focused on real criminal cases in the United States, especially involving police bodycam and dashcam footage.
I’m looking for a long-term partner who can not only edit but also help craft the story — turning raw footage into engaging, well-paced true crime videos.
???? What you’ll do:
Review and select key Upgrade to see actual infonts from raw police footage
Build a storyline structure: intro – development – ending
Cut/trim/edit video for clarity and pacing
Add intro/outro, transitions, and light sound effects
Insert background music and blur sensitive visuals
(Optional): Add English subtitles or captions
???? Bonus points if you:
Have experience in documentary or true crime content
Can write compelling YouTube titles, descriptions, and story outlines
Know how to create simple thumbnails
Understand U.S. criminal cases or law enforcement situations
???? What I’ll provide:
Raw bodycam/dashcam footage via Google Drive
Example videos to guide tone and format
???? Pay + Bonuses:
Starting budget: $20–25 per video (10–20 minutes)
Performance bonus available if your video performs well
More videos per week and long-term work for the right editor
???? To apply, please include:
Your portfolio (especially true crime, docu-style, or storytelling videos)
What software you use
Your rate per video (10–20 min)
How comfortable you are with story editing / content curation
How many videos you can handle per week
Thank you!
Looking forward to working with someone creative and passionate about true crime.
